page.description: Add buttons for the List Detail View - a genie will allow you to select Save, Undo, Synchronize, et. buttons.

section.description: Once they are assigned to an existing list control the buttons should appear fully functional in the component.

figure.title: The resulting buttons from the checked boxes in genie.

section.title: Create a Detail View that uses the List-Detail View-Buttons

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the Data Controls menu. Click on the [TextBox] option. Give the textbox the name 'ContactName' and the label 'Contact' and click OK.
Add a second textbox control to the component. Give this textbox the name and label of 'Address'.
Add a third textbox to the component. Set the name and label for this textbox to read 'City'
Add a fourth textbox with the name and label 'Country'.
Highlight all of the textbox controls in the controls tree. Open the 'Containers' menu and click on the [Container] option.
From the 'Container Type' list select the 'None' option and click OK.
Highlight the [Container End: CONTAINER_1] tag in the controls tree. Open the 'Data Controls' menu and click on [List] to add a list control.
Highlight list control. In the properties list on the right click on the 'List properties' property in the List Properties section to open the List Builder.
On the List Builder's 'Data Source' pane set the 'Data Source Type' to be 'SQL'.
In the SQL Data Source properties section click the [...] button next to the 'Connection string' property and build a connection string to the 'Northwind' database.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Table name' property. Select the 'Customers' table from the list of tables in the Northwind database.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Field list' property. Select the 'ContactName, Address, City, and Country fields and click OK.
Open the 'List Layout' pane. Use the blue arrow to move the four data fields from the 'Available Fields' list to the 'Columns in List:' section.
Open the List Properties pane. In the 'List Properties' section check the 'Has Detail View' checkbox.
Open the Detail View pane. In the Detail View Properties section set the 'Detail view type' property to be 'Container'.
Set the 'Detail view container' property to be 'CONTAINER_1', this is the container that holds all of the textboxes. Click OK to close the List Builder.
Highlight the [Container End: CONTAINER_1] tag. Open the 'Defined Controls' menu and select the 'List-Detail View-Buttons' option.
In the 'List-Detail View-Buttons' genie highlight 'list1'. Check the 'Save', 'New record', 'Delete record', and 'Synchronize' checkboxes and click OK.
The component should now look like this:
Run the component in Live Preview. Highlight a row in the List to display the Detail View.
Edit the Detail View and click the 'Save' button. The row in the list control should appear dirty.
Use the Synchronize button to add the changes to the list control. This will save the edits on the server.
